website_summaries.verdict: The Optoma HD142X has an image so good, it'll be tough for price-conscious home theater fans to justify paying more for a projector.
pros: The Optoma HD142X has very good overall image quality with full-HD resolution, solid contrast and accurate color
It's one of the least expensive projectors available for this level of quality
cons: Somewhat lighter black levels and less-accurate color than some more-expensive competitors

customer_reviews.title: but it looks like they aren't going to fix this without me shelling ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally write reviews but this one needs to be seen. After only two months of use the screen now has discoloration and dead pixels, both white and black. I have emailed Optoma and haven't gotten a response about some kind of warranty, but it looks like they aren't going to fix this without me shelling out a few hundred bucks. After doing some research, it looks like they cheap out of the thermal paste with their chips and they burn up pretty fast. So, short of me replacing the dmd chip myself which will also cost a couple hundred bucks, it appears I'm out $500. Don't buy this garbage, it will fail on you.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan J Aubrey

customer_reviews.title: Just like mike96a1 stated in his review
customer_reviews.text: Just like mike96a1 stated in his review, for some reason there is "oversplash" around the entire border of the projected image.. played around with some of the settings but have not found a way to get rid of it.. very annoying when projecting on a screen.. Picture quality is great, fan noise is minimal, just to bad it has this flaw... I hope Optoma sees this review and responds with a way to adjust or fix this issue.. I Will adjust the star rating if this issue gets resolved..
customer_reviews.author: Todd R. Metcalf

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Picture Projector
customer_reviews.text: This projector is seriously perfect!!!! I was worried when my husband bought it because it wasn’t one of the top priced projectors and usually the higher the price, the better the product... but this proved that theory wrong! The picture is literally perfect and it’s just on my living room wall. It fits my wall at any size I would want it from small to the entire wall size and the picture isn’t affected it all. The sound from the projector is loud enough to not even need separate speakers. The sound fills my entire room without it being at max volume. It was easy to set up and I absolutely love having it.
customer_reviews.author: Reneh

customer_reviews.title: Very poor picture quality- Images on the screen look dull (not bright enough)!
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews (which were very impressive) before I decided to buy this Optoma HD143X projector for our basement hometheater. In the begining I thought the picture quality was good. Incidentally I had to buy another projector (Viewsonic PA503S SVGA, much cheaper in price) soon after for our gameroom which allowed me to make a comparison between the two. Now I realize how dull the images are with the Optoma projector. I wish I hadn't believed the reviews and I had not bought the Optoma projector to begin with!
customer_reviews.author: Subrata Sarkar

customer_reviews.title: Amazing picture! I didn't expect this to lol as ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing picture! I didn't expect this to lol as good as my 1080p TV considering the screen would be 40 inches larger (100in) however my family and I were blown away with the picture. the black. levels are great! the contrast is amazing too. no input lag... waiting for my screen to be delivered I'm just projecting on a white wall for now
customer_reviews.author: Carson

customer_reviews.title: Second Optoma device failure
customer_reviews.text: I just unboxed the projector and plugged it in , it turned on then a noise came out of the device and the lamp start flashing then it shuts itself down , i cant believe it , THIS IS THE SECOND TIME I USED HD142X for a year then it deid on me , i oreded HD143X and it is defecitve !!!!!!!! This is a big fail Optoma
customer_reviews.author: faisal

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with Warranty void seal already broken.
customer_reviews.text: Great projector. But arrived with the warranty void of seal broken sticker already broken. Not sure if it happened during packaging or if I got a returned item, but I’m not happy with the fact I just bought it and the warranty is already void.
customer_reviews.author: kristopher s bennett

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest colors and the projector stopped working after 2 months and 80 hours on eco mode.
customer_reviews.text: Let me first start off by saying the good. It's native 1080p and very bright even during the day. The colors are pretty poor compared to my 5 year old LED projector which was a bit disappointing but not a deal breaker as it still looks decent enough. The fans on it are really quite and you can barely hear it. Unfortunately with just over 80 hours in eco mode and less than 2 months it looks like either the projector or the bulb died. I don't think this is common but because of my experience I cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: Remote does no responds no matter where I point, projector is setting on a table, cannot even setup. I was able to select language and get menu up one time but unable to get remote to move to item to select anything. Don't know about picture quality or anything else. Item is blowing out so much hot air I would never be able to use. Remote lights up is very nice but that's all it does.
customer_reviews.author: dcbag

customer_reviews.title: 1080p projector that just works good.
customer_reviews.text: See Update Works great! We have it hooked up to our receiver and use the auto power on/off option. Receiver kicks on when the Xbox one comes on. And turns off when the Xbox is powered off. Over all it has been perfect. Huge up grade over the $150 Chinese made projector we had before this one. Works good in normal room lightning. UPDATE!!! The Fan on this Projector is on it's way out. It's getting loud.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great picture but not as stable as previous model.
customer_reviews.text: Second Optoma projector. Had previous model, HD 142X until it started shutting off for no apparent reason. Bought the new replacement model. In my opinion the older model was better. New model has stability problems staying on one color scheme. It will randomly switch between hues, brightness, or color schemes (not sure which specifically). It’ll do it while presenting any random moving image. It’s not terrible but it’s noticeable. The older model didn’t have this issue. I think it’s just part of the color or brightness auto adjustment feature but it doesn’t work seemlessly. At least this is my experience while hooked up to my AppleTv.
customer_reviews.author: M.T. Cicero

customer_reviews.title: There are better options out there
customer_reviews.text: Oversplash can be disturbing. Bigger you project the screen bigger the oversplash If you use on bright mode lamp does not last as much as hd142x. But most stupid thing with this product is there are only two adjustable leg one of them made out of hard plastic if you plan to set this on a uneven surface have fun. Well good thing , it is bright enough.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Broken Audio
customer_reviews.text: As another reviewer has experienced, my units audio is defective. I have tried using different hdmi cables in both ports but the result is simply a digital sounding screech at all times. Should have gone with Epson or even ViewSonic.
customer_reviews.author: C.H.

customer_reviews.title: Great projector
customer_reviews.text: This is a great projector. I knocked off a star because ours started buzzing after a couple weeks. Probably a fluke but still couldn't give it 5 stars after that. Picture was great. Very basic and simple setup. Ended up upgrading to hd27 after returning this. After one use it's obvious that the extra contrast ratio and lumens make a big difference. For the extra 30 or 50 bucks I recommend the hd27. If this is all you can afford then you can't go wrong with this one either. Assuming the buzzing was just a fluke, which I think it was.
customer_reviews.author: J.Hester

customer_reviews.title: Rainbow effect, very large throw distance
customer_reviews.text: It's a good projector. But there is a bunch of flaws that made me return this. DLP projectors comes with what's called a Rainbow effect and this one definitely has it, a lot. Also the picture is smaller than what you get on other projectors at the same distance. The projector only has verical keystone correction so adjusting the picture is entirely up to your mounting mechanism. There is no options to fix the image if it is distorted. The good things: Great quality picture, lots of good and accurate color, great black to white contrast ratio. Gets very bright even if you have ambient light. Super quiet. Still, the flaws make it an inferior product compared to its peers.
customer_reviews.author: Ajay

customer_reviews.title: Crispy clear picture in 1080p text mode
customer_reviews.text: I tried 2 other brands claiming 1080p native resolution and more than 3000 lumin and selling around 250. They ended up not so good picture quality and I think they are mostly due to low quality optical system. Bad quality means you can never focus well in all area of the screen, which is why they always prefer viewing movie than ppt and text. This is expensive but it delivers the right quality to me, so it is worth the money. Picture is crispy clear, in both text modes and picture/movie/TV mode. Color is vivid. I simply project it on my wall with plain antique white painting and it delivers very good image. Recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Peter WU

customer_reviews.title: Click buy it now!!  You wont be mad.
customer_reviews.text: Been using optima for 10 years for my outside projector. No way you can argue with that. Smokes the Epson in the same price range 7000 more co trast ratio. Kids love it. Not waiting til pitch dark anymore for the fire pit movie. Deff a safe bet. Plus who needs the other features the 800$ ones come with. Unless you go 4000 lumens. The money isnt with it. $20 computer speakers. Worked perfect as the pair.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin McKee

customer_reviews.title: A Really Nice Projector
customer_reviews.text: Great projector at a great price. I thought I would be annoyed at the light surrounding the image that others have mentioned, but with a black wall and black curtains, I don't even notice it. The only thing that really bothers me is the rainbow effect (I'm one of those people). Other than that, the image is vivid, bright with great contrast and the black level is quite good. It's also very quiet and the fan only runs for about 20 seconds after shutdown. I use this mounted on the ceiling with an HDMI wireless receiver with no trouble at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I have had this projector for a little over 2 years and it just stopped working one day. The picture was decent while it lasted and it seemed like a great deal but it did not last. I had less than 200 hours on it and the bulb was supposed to last 5000+. The lights on the unit indicate lamp failure but I do not believe it was actually the lamp that failed. I believe it was actually the power supply that went out. What a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A Appleby

customer_reviews.title: Better than going to the movies
customer_reviews.text: With movie theaters gone due to covid, I decided to pull the trigger and get this projector and a 120 inch screen for movie nights...simply put, its amazing...perfect quality, suoer sharp focus, and seriously bright! Also it is whisper quiet and at around $500, its as good a deal as it gets. Haven't tried the 3D yet, but a Mad Max Fury Road 3D viewing is on my movie list....just get it and enjoy movies the way they were meant to be
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Not good.
customer_reviews.text: Came all scraped and scratched up. Not worth the money. One of the legs was actually glued so we can’t even adjust height. So disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Emma

customer_reviews.title: Good projector but bulb didn’t even make it to 100 hours.
customer_reviews.text: Great colors and brightness! However the lamp failed on the 90th day of the 90 warranty with barely 80 hours on the unit. Optoma agreed to repair the unit but make the customer pay the shipping which was 67$. The customer shouldn’t have to pay 1/3 of the price of a bulb for their faulty product. Also it has been 4 weeks with minimal communication about how long it is going to take. Other than that issue the projector quality has been great.
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Cheap enough,but features limited
customer_reviews.text: Cheap.We use these often and they are pretty good but do burn through bulbs more freq. than others we use. LIMITED features such as zoom/focus,so you have to be exact as to where you mate it w/screen. If you need a cheapie use this,if you can up the budget run from this aging out model.For our purposes its ok
customer_reviews.author: njrapid

customer_reviews.title: Worry about projecting under low-medium light? Don't worry.
customer_reviews.text: For the price point, this is an excellent product. If you're worried about the picture not showing up well, don't worry. I searched for a day to make sure I would land on a projector that'll work under low to medium light. I use my projector during the day, with a thin-ish curtain down (they're definitely not black out curtains), with another window further from the projector completely uncovered, watched a movie with it just fine. I also used it when most of the lights were on inside my house at night, still getting a very vibrant image, which would be considered medium to even high light condition.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Chan

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, high value 1080p projector
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific project. Great 1080p picture quality. Modest fan noise in bright mode, very faint in eco mode. It lacks a bit of flexibility in zoom, but if you're setting up a home theater and can plan for it, it can work. In my case, I'm using it about 14' from the projection wall, throwing a 140" diagonal picture. This is a great alternative to 4K projectors, if you are waiting for those to come down in price.
customer_reviews.author: R. Stern

customer_reviews.title: Did not receive usermanual and cant access image settings
customer_reviews.text: After accesssing an online manual, I have followed instructions and went to the main menu and then the display settings. FRom the display sub menu, I only see key stone adjustment. There is no other settings. The manual online has instructions for multiple types of remotes. Perhaps I am looking at a manual that is telling me that I should be seeing settings taht are not there . I was unsuccessful in making setting adjustments so that my projection was off of my ceiling. It is extremely frusterating to spend 500.00 on an item and not be able to get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Stephls.

customer_reviews.title: Can't turn on using any remote
customer_reviews.text: Remote control suddenly stopped turning on projector. I have old optima remote and universal remote the same problem. Turning it off works fine. 6 months old. I could still use projector on button, it works for now. I used Optoma projectors for 20 years, first time I have an issue. Usually, bulb dies after 150% of it's life and nothing else.
customer_reviews.author: Bill G.

customer_reviews.title: Solid projector for multiuse. Works well in ambient light.
customer_reviews.text: We used this to replace smaller/ portable style projector. Goal was for brighter picture with some daytime/ ambient light and higher picture quality in time for 2016 olympics. It has delivered on both fronts. It is a little bulkier than the minis, but still not too much of an eye soar if left out. Plenty bright enough for room with moderate daytime light (no direct sun). Picture quality is great. Delivers crisp, top quality HD picture. We've used with digital antenna, streaming roku, and streaming from mac book (hdmi). Mostly movies and TV with some sports. All have delivered true to form and resolution. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: A Scheifele

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Picture
customer_reviews.text: The picture that this Optoma HD243 1080P produces is beyond belief, Simply Unbelievable! This is not my first Optoma and the last one was also Amazing and lasted 15 Years! Project onto 120” Elite Screen! Highest Quality and Workmanship! Unbeatable at this price! Comparable to units at three times this price! Highly Recommended Without Hesitation!
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Shelton

customer_reviews.title: A very good low budget projector
customer_reviews.text: If you cannot spend more then this is great. I found the focus inconsistent throughout the picture. It would often have pixelation issues. The remote works well with bounce technology but feels very cheap. Also the projector looks amazing, it’s black and sleek which I really prefer over more expensive white ones.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: First projector was a dud, second one seems fine
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the first model I received as it started flickering badly. Dynamic black was off and it was set to low brightness settings, but the lamp showed signs of failure after only a week of use and after 3 weeks it was clearly about to burn out. My previous Optoma projector lasted 18 months before dying. Fortunately it failed quickly enough for me to be able to get a replacement sent and it seems to work fine. I'll adjust my review if I start to have problems again.Customer service for Amazon and Optoma were helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Frederick

customer_reviews.title: 2 years now
customer_reviews.text: I have had this projector for 2 years, and it literally runs almost 24/7. The picture is crisp and the blacks are BLACK projecting from about 10’ away, and I project onto a wall that is light grey instead of white. After 2 years, I am only now starting to consider putting in a new lamp. Not because it is becoming washed out to our eyes, but just because I know that with the number of hours on my lamp I will need one soon. Even in a fully lit room, this is a great starter for your home theater!
customer_reviews.author: Jason T.

customer_reviews.title: Get aux cable to connect external speaker for an awesome indoor or outdoor experience.
customer_reviews.text: Love the projector. We have hosted quarantine lawn movies while also keeping distant but also enjoying the weather! The only reason I gave this 4 instead of 5 stars is due to the speaker. I would suggest a cable that has two male "headphone type" ends for connecting an external speaker. I choose a 100 in screen. The projector sits 8 feet away comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Susan C Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Great company, wonderful projector for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this projector for awhile now, and I've treated myself to some great 3D DVD's. I've had Optoma's before and saw no reason to jump ship to another company. Although 3D itself is not as exciting as I had hoped, the performance of this projector has far exceeded expectations. I'm having great fun with this unit. Home theater is constantly changing; my next big thing is Dolby Atmos on the audio side. I can't go to see things in the theaters because they turn up the volume so high it distorts, and hurts my ears. Having a great system at home is my best defense. This projector is future proof - and I'm having fun with it.
customer_reviews.author: Searcher 101

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating set up
customer_reviews.text: I will update this review after I have successfully set up the projector and used it. The projector comes with a single sheet that sends you to their website for an online user manual. This specific model's user manual is no longer available on the website. This model is not even shown on their website currently. I've been on hold for 20 minutes with their support team trying to find a user manual. I already regret buying the "budget" projector.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Brown

customer_reviews.title: Nice projector so far!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, we mostly use it with Apple TV and looks awesome. I've put it on a light tan wall and a light blue wall and the picture looked great on both. Focusing is easy as well as set up. We were watching it 5 min out of the box and the whole family was in awe! We've only had it a few weeks but I hope I don't have to come back and redo my review.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W.

customer_reviews.title: Great projector for the price - 1080p image and not ultra HD
customer_reviews.text: We were very happy with our 15-year old Optoma (H77) projector that finally died, forcing us to get a new projector. I was pleasantly surprised to see HD146X selling for only $550. This is a great price for us - granted that the projector only displays 1080p signals (still a better display quality than out old projector) and has much better brightness and dynamic range. If you are looking for a great value for money (I can't really justify the big price difference between UHD and 1080P projectors) then you can't go much better than this projector.
customer_reviews.author: Nanette P.

customer_reviews.title: Failed in less than 4 months of minimal use!
customer_reviews.text: Product functioned well for 4 months. Then 4 days out of the return period through Amazon it had a catastrophic failure. While watching this morning it made a horrendous clattering sound. Quickly reached to unplug it. Let cool down and powered up several hours later only to find that it no longer did more than make a winding sound like a searching cd drive. We bought this particular model because of its positive reviews regarding reliability and quality. Now I have to figure out how to work the warranty from our home in Costa Rica. To say I am dissatisfied is an understatement.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Vandenberg

customer_reviews.title: Best projector under $500
customer_reviews.text: This projector is honestly the best you can buy under $500. I am using it for my home theater set up and it's great. First mounting the projector to the ceiling was a breeze. I did buy a celing mount and had no issues. Next was getting the picture adjusted was super easy using the remote. I flipped the image since my projector was upside down and focusing was easy as well. Lastly the picture quality is very impressing in dark rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Karla

customer_reviews.title: Stop looking, buy now
customer_reviews.text: This is my third protector, and by far the best. The price is extremely reasonable. Go look at 100" hd tv's and get back to me, this is a way better bargain. I actually turned the brightness down. It's like watching an actual LCD tv it's so bright. That is with a ALR screen with gain of 1.3. Overall. I love it. Buy a surround sound system. But that's a no brainer for projectors.
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: We could not ask for better picture quality
customer_reviews.text: We are so impressed with how this has changed our movie watching experience. We could not ask for better picture quality. Even Netflix and Amazon Prime movies look fantastic. A great product for the money and surpassed what we expected.
customer_reviews.author: mdmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped turning on after approximately 100 hours of use over a 2-1/2 year period of time.
customer_reviews.text: Only had about 100 hours at 2-1/2 years old(out of warranty) on my projector and it stopped turning on. Optima support informed me that it's $125 to ship and have it looked at, then there will be repair and shipping on top of that. He expressed to me how purchasing a new unit probably makes more sense. What a waste. I will have to purchase a new one and it won't be Optima. By the way, the projector would go out randomly, here and there, for about 15 seconds while watching something.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie C.

customer_reviews.title: Quirky Projector
customer_reviews.text: Pro's - terrific picture - quiet fan Con's - Oversplash is ridiculous (your screens black border needs to be 5" minimum to contain) - 1 of the 3 legs is not adjustable (!) - HDMI sync is a pain when navigating blu ray menus I can live with the con's as long as this projector proves as durable as my last Optoma. My HD65 lasted 9 years with no problems. I'm hoping for similar reliability and if I get it than the 3 star rating increases to a 4.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but then.....
customer_reviews.text: Better than most less expensive projectors but not as bright in color depth and image was a lil blurry Update: had a replacement sent image quality was way better and no blur really enjoyed it until I noticed I wasn't able to focused the image anymore had it for 2 months I use it for my everyday use was thinking of upgrading to the optoma hd27 darbee but scared I'll have the same problem considering getting another brand :/ I really like optima brand
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Bought a Vankyo v600 first. Get this instead.
customer_reviews.text: Tried to save some money by getting a Vankyo since it was $200 cheaper and had the same resolution. It wasn't as bright, had a lower quality 1080p picture and I could not get it focused. The screen would focus left to right instead of all at once. This projector is ten times better. It has a much better, brighter picture as well as a much quieter fan. Only complaint is the remote is too bright at night.
customer_reviews.author: Laura R. Witham

customer_reviews.title: Great projector for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks! It's very bright even in daylight with my ALR screen, even in eco mode. I will say if you have a setup where your pretty close to the projector and you have it on a high brightness setting you will definitely hear it when the fan kicks in. It is definitely audible. Another issue that I could point out is if you have your video signals controlled by a AV receiver and switch inputs, the projector like to cycle through all inputs looking for a signal before coming back to the original input. I find this annoying and haven't been able to turn this off, but aside from that I love it.
customer_reviews.author: AshyDuckling

customer_reviews.title: Great picture. Terrible reliability.
customer_reviews.text: It looks great. But I’ve found it’s lower price is too good to be true. I’ve had two of these fail on me within a couple months with 200 and 800 hours on them. Both started showing vertical lines. I bought this to try out having a projector and love it. But my next higher end projector won’t be a optoma. Their customer support has been good. The product bad
customer_reviews.author: Todd Snyder

customer_reviews.title: best bang for your hard earned cash
customer_reviews.text: wow simply wow! this is a great projector. this is just as good as a $2000 and up projector. for 549 bucks its a steal. image quality is phenomenal ad crisp. color accuracy is just amazing. internal speaker sucks but thats an easy fix with a souind system that you gonna want anyway. i love Optoma and this is a real review!
customer_reviews.author: cedric

customer_reviews.title: Great Picture - Bright Lamp - Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this projector. I use it both indoors (100” screen) and outdoors (200” screen). The remote has nice backlight, but menu and navigation are not great. Frustrated that the projector keeps putting itself in “bright” mode, where instead “cinema” mode looks most true-to-life. Even though it’s only 1080P, it makes up for it in great picture quality and reasonable price. Outdoors it is about 25’ from the screen, and still bright enough to cast the vibrant 200” image. Attached photo and video are my outdoor setup on outdoor screen I also bought on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: Remote  control
customer_reviews.text: this projector came with the worse remote control ever built let me explain: no matter how close you are to the remote sensor it takes click after click to make this thing to work;The same day the unit arrived ,I replace the batteries,thinking that the issue were the batteries I installed new ones and the problems still the same very cheap remote I'm about to had it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent budget projector!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my garage. Picture is pretty bright in the day. I’ve only ran it at 4:3 because that’s the ratio of the screen I have. I did quite a bit of research before purchasing and this seemed to be the best bang for the buck. I purchased a Bluetooth receiver and it connects to my sound bar perfectly. If your in the fence, go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Loftin

customer_reviews.title: audio sucks!!
customer_reviews.text: It took like a week and a half to receive this because for some reason it was last. The replacement is good but the audio sucks, but everything else is good.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Stunning quality with super quiet fan
customer_reviews.text: 2019 Optoma replaced a Chinese HD projector. It is insanely quiet. Second, it's super bright, watched movies during the day with curtains closed. Remote for some reason needs to be held next to the projector to turn it on, except for that little caveat we are very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Home Cinema Projector.. Love It
customer_reviews.text: I searched lots of projectors. Someone recommended Vivitek to me costing $1300. I found this Optoma with great Contrast ratio and lumens with DLP technology and plus amazon delivered to me in 2 days since I am Prime customer. I must say I am highly satisfied with this purchase. It is terrific projector for Home Cinema. I connected Roku to it and its rocking. I wanted to connect my existing sound bar so I went to Best Buy and they recommended a device that you can connect to Projector sound out and it becomes bluetooth trasmitter which can now connect to my sound bar. I am really happy customer on this Optoma.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: An excellent choice!
customer_reviews.text: First time buyer and I had never messed with a proyector before. I did research on google and YouTube reviews and I was happy with this one. Performance and price were certainly convincing. Picture quality is great and the colors are vivid. The proyector's Fan is fairly quiet. It does create a bit of heat so a well ventilated area for it is a must. In coclusion, I am very satisfied with my purchase and I would definitely buy again. Hope this helped, cheers! P. S I used a 120" screen. Sorry I'm not the best photographer.
customer_reviews.author: J.Lara

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my 10 year old, broken BenQ. The picture is very nice for home theater and I have it projected onto a 110” screen. You can hear a little hum from the projector but I don’t think it’s annoying at all and it’s literally on the ceiling right above my theater seating. Nice and bright picture. The projection adjustability (up/down/left/right) is a little less friendly than my old BenQ but it’s still manageable. It didn’t come with any screws for ceiling mount, but it just takes (3) 4mm x 10mm long screws you can get at any hardware store. I highly recommend this projector if you’re looking to do your theater on a budget!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Masse

customer_reviews.title: Best one Yet
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th projector I bought this year. Had to return the others. ( No base, inside speaker wouldn't turn off, no sound at all after 3 months) Optoma is the best one of all the others: icobus, infocus, etc. Used for 10 hours now and seems to run cooler. Color is perfect, gamma adjustable. Has to be perfectly straight, least bit off showed up on my 80" screen. Watched Stranger Things with my Roku and it looked just as good if not better than the movie theater.
customer_reviews.author: DYTRIPPER

customer_reviews.title: Love this projector!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great projector for the price. Hooked up a sound bar for better sound. Also hooked up iPad to stream from Netflix, Disney plus and prime. I even hooked up blue ray DVD player to watch old movies. Bought an AV cart to put all devices in one spot so I can watch in my livingroom or roll it outside with ease. The picture quality is amazing. Bright enough to start watching movies outside at dusk. I wish it had more hook ups but with a little research and purchasing a few extra cables I have been able to get what I need out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Jen S

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good projector for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good projector for the price. Only complaint is it takes forever to sync with an HDMI signal (only one input!??) and it should just come up instantly really, but instead it spins a little icon for several seconds (how many frames do you guys need BenQ/TI?) before getting a native resolution signal... Still excellent picture, decent brightness and decent color :).
customer_reviews.author: M. Fleischer

customer_reviews.title: BANG for your BUCK! AWESOME Projector!!!
customer_reviews.text: After trying few different projectors! Gave this one try - looked into it a tons, read, watched videos. Finally Purchased it. Let me just say! We are blown away by the picture quality of this projector. Image is crisp and clean. We have been using it over 6 months now and absolutely love it! there was very little setup - aligning up the screen a little adjusting the colors a little and bam! it was good to go. I would never purchase another brand ever again!.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse C.

customer_reviews.title: Look no further for a fantastic 1080p 3D projector!
customer_reviews.text: Considering how expensive projectors can be, this one is a bargain. Unless you put this up next to a Vivetek, Sony or JVC in the same room, you will think you are looking at a $2500 projector. The clarity, color, keystone settings, etc are spot on. Have installed several of these over the last couple of years and will continue to do so. The fan sound is minuscule, so no distractions for the quiet scenes of your favorite movie.
customer_reviews.author: North Texas Audio Video

customer_reviews.title: Movie night here I come!
customer_reviews.text: Love this projector. Purchased it for backyard movies with friends and family and it works great. Its virtually plug and play. I plugged in my fire stick tv and my Nyne Bass Speaker and started streaming movies. I did have to buy a WiFi extender in order to get a strong enough signal. Works best after dark where I picture is great!
customer_reviews.author: LicheeNut

customer_reviews.title: Great picture! Many picture and viewing options
customer_reviews.text: Great picture! Many picture and viewing options. The reasons for 4 stars and not 5: firstly the physical HDMI inputs are not very tight which causes lost signal if not positioned just right. Secondly the picture will drop occasionally, I initially thought it was my pass through amplifier, but it does it with a newer model amp as well. I have to recycle the amp , and ps4 to rectify this anomaly. Still impressed with the overall product.
customer_reviews.author: rdj

customer_reviews.title: Very nice projector. I bought it for my new house
customer_reviews.text: Very nice projector. I bought it for my new house, left our old one with the last house. Has a great picture, set up was pretty easy, focus is very good. Stays in focus much better than my last projector. Picture is beautiful very happy with that. The Fan isn't too noisy, we really don't notice it. The internal speaker is there but really isn't for watching movies or home theater use. I have a bose system and this setup is working really well for us.
customer_reviews.author: MattM

customer_reviews.title: Got a Used and Broken Model. Paid for New.
customer_reviews.text: I paid for a new one. But I got a used one. The security seal was broken. The protective adhesive on the projector was bubbled and scuffed up. And the first time I tried to watch a movie, it showed a dialog saying it was shutting down and I should contact a repair shop. You may be lucky enough to get a new one. You decide if you want to roll the dice. (I included a picture of the broken security seal.)
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Schaff

customer_reviews.title: Great quality project
customer_reviews.text: Great quality project. Great price. Only critique is the zoom range. It has a very narrow zoom range. Pretty much place the projector at the distance required to cast the size for your screen and only rely on the zoom adjust for the last fine adjustment. This can be very problematic for someone who doesn't want to ceiling mount the projector in the middle of their home theater!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: got a lemon - lamp burned out after a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: was working great, until it didn't. Says the lamp burned out. Have to send it in under warranty, which is a pain. It has not be convenient. We will see if they fix the problem. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Wow! What a picture.
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a picture. We project it on our blue wall to watch movies 10 feet wide and it is amazing. Our 55 inch hd tv has nothing on this projector...even during the day. We love it. Can't wait till it's warm enough to try it outdoors. It would be fantastic for a den, home movie room, outdoor movies, you name it. Playing video games with this is amazing and a ton of fun with friends. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nwebb

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product and Unfair pricing.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two products and both were defective which I have returned. Each had defective sound cards. I really wanted the product and when I tried to order a third one, I was told by Amazon they can not match the original sale price for products one and two because they no longer keep it in stock. How unfair to waste weeks trying to buy the product only to find them defective and never get a proper functioning product at the original price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Picture is beautiful and for its price, it is almost perfect. Its pretty bulky so make sure you have space for it. The downside really is that there is only 1 hdmi spot, no wifi or Bluetooth connectivity and the stock sound is really bad. The picture quality makes up for it all but the minor tweaks would really take it to the next level. I know that there are 4k projectors out there but not worth almost double in price.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Decent but could be better
customer_reviews.text: Overall decent projector. For dark spaces like media rooms or basements it’s very bright, too bright. This causes the image to be washed out and contrast to be off which hinders color reproduction. But in rooms with some ambient light it should have better performance. This projector also produces a rainbow effect which my other 3 projectors didn’t.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful little projector.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this projector for a few months now and I love it. The picture quality is great and I have no issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: The Yoho

customer_reviews.title: Not up to the standards of Optoma
customer_reviews.text: I had my previous Optoma for more than 10 years and it worked like a work horse. Unfortunately the build on this one felt a little flimsy for what I have come to expect from Optoma. I still put it up and tried my best fall in love with the unit. The deal breaker breaker was when tiny blue spots appearing allover the screen - think of old televisions during bad reception. I replaced this with a higher model (4k), and that is working great!!
customer_reviews.author: Rajiv

customer_reviews.title: Optoma are a terrible company to deal with
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in early 2018. Then the HDCP standard came in and made this projector useless as it would not stream movies After spending days to get intouch with someone in Optoma they basically said - tough luck buy a new one..... I asked could i part exchange or send it back for retrofit and they said no, buy a new one. Optoma - you have lost a customer 4ever and i hope others stay away
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Awesome picture
customer_reviews.text: Awesome picture for the money. I only paid $399. The price went up to $700 plus now. Don't think it's worth that. There are other good machines for less.
customer_reviews.author: young m.

customer_reviews.title: Super bright, perfect for home theater
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Optoma projector to replace an older Epson projector. This new projector has a picture quality that is awesome! It is great how the remote control illuminates and is easy to use. Another thing I noticed is how quiet the fan is on this projector. With my old projector I had to turn the sound way up in order to hear the movie. Now with this projector I barely notice the fan noise at all!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good projector - Not totally wowed
customer_reviews.text: I am not totally wowed by the projector. It is quiet, seemingly nice picture quality, good zooming, focus, and keystone. I was able to fit the picture to space as desired but had to customize the location of the projector. The picture wouldn't fit from the designated spot I had planned to house the projector. (The projector house was too high relative to the screen - I had to mount the projector underneath the prescribed projector house.)
customer_reviews.author: Robin Struyk

customer_reviews.title: High Pitch Electrical Buzzing
customer_reviews.text: This device emits a loud high pitch buzzing, I have had mine replaced and the second unit does it too. Seems to be an issue with the product line itself. Because of this, it is very annoying when watching quiet style movies and TV. If you are older you cannot probably hear the frequency so it will be fine. The image itself is great though, shame the noise is a deal breaker for me.
customer_reviews.author: Zondor

customer_reviews.title: Good Projector!
customer_reviews.text: A solid projector with few issues. I knew what I bought so I'm satisfied with it. The only issue I have is the light around the edges that some people speak about. It bothers me but I will live with it. This, the four stars.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin

customer_reviews.title: Great projector!
customer_reviews.text: Not a technical review here... Just have to say the picture is bright and clear. Showing movies outside from 10 feet onto a 100 inch screen. Usually start the movie a bit before dusk. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cybermonkey

customer_reviews.title: Great Colors, pretty bright, great value
customer_reviews.text: In the box is the projector, power cable, remote, batteries and paperwork. We are using this in our church Gym to project onto a 150” screen. With all gym lights image is visible but not ideal. The magic happens when you bring down the ambiant light and then you see the quality this thing brings. The colors are awesome and refresh rate is very good. For the money this seems to be one of the best projectors on the market. Also the throw on this projector is Short compared to others I have used. I’m getting 150” about 10’ from the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: He hooked in his xbox one and a sound system and now he's playing games and watching movies like in a theater
customer_reviews.text: Hubby has been wanting a projector for a long time a bought this one for husband's man cave. He hooked in his xbox one and a sound system and now he's playing games and watching movies like in a theater. He loves it and anxiously awaiting football season. Great picture, easy set up. Great choice for first projector.
customer_reviews.author: just me

customer_reviews.title: First projector - impressed
customer_reviews.text: This is great! Wish we would have gone this route a long time ago. Our house is a 1.5 story and the attic is finished. So we put this in the attic with short walls and a slanted ceiling. Couldn't be happier with the results. We had been looking for a tv wall mount instead but couldn't find anything that would work so we picked this. It was the right choice for our needs. Picture quality is crisp and even projecting from an angle to a different angle we can still get a perfect rectangle with equal sides.

customer_reviews.title: Very surprised buy this projector
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm very happy with this projector. The picture is clear at 1080p, even with the lights on. Videogames play very well. The 3D is amazing! I run my Nvidia shield for most of my entertainment, using steam link for steam, Xbox one and PS4 work pretty darn perfectly. For the price, I highly recommend this projector. I wish I'd done this before I spent more on a TV.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher B.

customer_reviews.title: This product produces a great image for the price
customer_reviews.text: I definitely did my research before purchasing this product. I read and watched I don't know how many reviews. All I can say is that the reviews were right. This product produces a great image for the price. I can only imagine what one of those super expensive units produce. I am extremely glad I picked this one. Just realize that no picture or video that you see online of the projectors image quality will do it justice. You need to see the image in person.
customer_reviews.author: Chaco714

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else....
customer_reviews.text: Shows fan locked and turns power off... Can clearly hear the fan because it's noisy, had it maybe a year... Great in the beginning but now a $500 paper weight...
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this projector!
customer_reviews.text: Love our Optima projector! Can't hear the fan. It's small but packs an amazing full HD picture. We're obsessed with our theater! The picture I included is about 135 inch screen.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: So far, I like the projector. The one gripe I have is I wish it had a setting allowing me to place the projector off center (to the left or right of screen) and adjust the picture size. It has a setting for placing the projector above or below the screen but nothing for left or right.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Great projector!
customer_reviews.text: Great projector ! We have been looking a a new one for sometime now. We use the projector in our livingroom as our tv not just for movies so it had to be bright and this one is perfect!!! It is also amazing for gaming and movies as well. Very quiet. The first picture is before we sized it to fit our screen but it is during the day with all our windows open and livingroom lights on. The second picture is after we sized it to our screen. It is at night with all our livingroom lights on. P
customer_reviews.author: Brittny H.

customer_reviews.title: Great So Far
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I’ve purchased a few different brands and so far this one is the best. Other brand was BenQ and the quality of the Optima is much better. The BenQ I had return a day after using, it had boot up problems and was a lot louder.
customer_reviews.author: Avid-Shopper

customer_reviews.title: ... not regret for a second as it was as good as the extensive reviews I read before buying
customer_reviews.text: This was my first major purchase from Amazon and I did not regret for a second as it was as good as the extensive reviews I read before buying. True HD performance with very low noise from the cooling fan. The picture from my BR 'Beauty and the Beast' was stunning. I tried the 3D display with the active glasses I bought and with some setting adjustment I was able to enjoy immersive effect in FF8 and Guardians of the Galaxy. Although I later discovered that ultra short throw projector is more suitable for my room size, I will keep this projector for other occasions.
customer_reviews.author: George Wong

customer_reviews.title: super poor audio
customer_reviews.text: The picture is great but the audio is unbelievable poor. Beamer hangs over me from the ceiling and i can barely hear it. I don't know if that is how it is supposed to be or mine is broken or what.
customer_reviews.author: Bernd Bauer

customer_reviews.title: looks good once the sun goes down
customer_reviews.text: Using it outside in the back yard. It looks good once the sun goes down. It's my first projector and meets expectations for the price, but next time, I'll want: 1. WIFI connectivity so I don't need to drag a DVD player around. 2. More adjustments for the screen / image. You can only zoom in/out a 'little bit' with this projector. 3. Speaker in the projector is basically unusable, a better speaker would be nice to have
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Nice budget projector
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a HD 33. The first unit arrived and had a very loud fan, even in eco mode. Sent it back (fast and easy return through Amazon) and second unit is as quiet as the HD 33 it was replacing. Picture is fantastic, but the menu is not as intuitive as the HD 33 (hence 4 stars). But, hard to beat for the price...nearly half the price of the previous projector. Using it with Xbox one and 3d Blue Ray player...100 inches of glorious 1080P picture.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality image and fairly quite fan
customer_reviews.text: Good quality image and fairly quite fan. Easy to set up and projects a bright image. Fully compatible at full HD and plays moves with minimal DLP artifacts. Color saturation is a bit light but adjustment helps. The unit runs pretty hot as most of these do but seems to run for hours without difficulty. The remote works well and is convenient. It would be nice if this unit included a carrying case as the whole thing seems pretty fragile.
customer_reviews.author: Dave K.

customer_reviews.title: This is the one if you're not going 4K
customer_reviews.text: Picture is phenomenal for video games and film/TV. Sports are unreal clear. Good in decently lit rooms, definitely what you're looking for in dark rooms. Contrast ratio is excellent, multiple layers of blacks. Colours are vibrant (watch Planet Earth and tell me you're not impressed). Overall the best projector I've ever owned (I've owned a few). If you're not going 4k hit this one up. You won't regret it. Only cons are as follows: 1) I want an even bigger picture (at about 15 feet I get 130 inches on my apartment wall) and 2) it can be a tad loud, BUT if you've got a good speaker system you won't notice the slight hum whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING 3d Dlp projector for under $600.
customer_reviews.text: Setup was a breeze, picture quality is great, brightness is good in a variety of settings. The 3D works amazing as well with or without the transmitter. Honestly I was expecting another piece of Junk (this is my third projector in this price range) and I was seriously impressed. If you are looking for a great projector for the money, you need this one.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great product bad design
customer_reviews.text: Picture is great. Would be 5 stars but the foot adjustments are a horrible design. Only the front and back right feet adjust. Back left doesnt move, making it impossible to lineup because it goes crooked.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Nice projector, poor packaging
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is sharp. Audio is adequate. Disappointed in the packaging as there wasn't a cover over the lens and the glass did come cracked. It also didn't come with a manual. The remote that came with it doesn't appear to be for this model as it has buttons that the projector does not have the capabilities of doing. However, I use a Roku with it and just use their remote instead.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Great projector for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased only Optoma projectors for the past 10 years. I've used projectors since 1997 and settled on Optoma because of value, quality, and their long use life. I currently have the 142X and 143X and look forward to purchasing one of their 4K's next time around.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl W. Graham

product_meta.title: Optoma HD142X 1080p 3000 Lumens 3D DLP Home Theater Projector
product_meta.description: Style:3000 Lumens/2017 ModelThe Optoma HD142X is a dynamic and cost-effective 1080p Home Theater Projector packed with an array of features including 3000 lumens, 1920 x 1080 FullHD Resolution, 1.1x Zoom, sRGB support, and 23,000:1 contrast ratio. The HD142X is the perfect Home Theater Projector for watching Blu-ray movies on movie night or Games of Thrones on a Sunday Evening. The 8000-hour lamp life leads to extended hours of viewing with limited need for maintenance and a lower overall cost-of-use without sacrificing outstanding picture quality. The HD142X is a great projector for gaming platforms including Xbox One, PS4, and your Personal Computer. The advance optical lens, crisp 1080p graphics and deep blacks produce detailed and vivid graphics and textures. sRGB color profile enables rich accurate color, based on the primaries of Rec.709 HDTV specification when used with a PC, Mac, or any sRGB compatible source. It features the latest and greatest digital media interface with support for MHL v1.2-enabled HDMI ports and is compatible with MHL devices such as Optoma’s HDCast Pro, Roku Streaming Stick and Smart Phones which connect directly to the projector to playback music and video, view pictures and even share web pages and other user generated digital media content.
feature_bullets: Screen Size Range: 66-inches from 8 feet; 107-inches from 12 feet
Brightness: 3,000 ANSI Lumens. Computer compatibility: FHD, HD, WXGA, UXGA, SXGA, XGA, SVGA, VGA, Mac
Contrast Ratio: 23,000:1; Keystone Correction: Yes, Lens Shift: No
2 x HDMI (1.4a 3D support) + MHL v1.2, Audio Out 3.5mm, 12V trigger, 3D-Sync, USB service Display Technology: Single 0.65” 1080p DC3 DMD chip DLP Technology by Texas Instruments
Operating Conditions: 5°C - 40°C, Max. Humidity 85%, Max. Altitude 3000m

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,732 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
